James Jordan is loving wife Ola Jordan being pregnant - because of her massive boobs.

The former Strictly Come Dancing couple, who have been together for 20 years, can't wait to welcome their first child after IVF struggles.

Speaking at the Pride Of Britain awards, Ola admitted she has noticed a positive change in caring James' behaviour.

On how she is coping with pregnancy, Ola said: It's good. I'm doing well. Rolling along. Eating well."

While James confessed: "Her boobs are massive. I love it."

Ola revealed that James has been helping out loads and doing a lot of extra housework.

(Image: Getty Images)

He admitted: "I'm quite a softie. I'm very protective. I'm always making sure she's careful when she's walking up the stairs and all the housework I'm doing."

At the weekend, James voiced his disappointment that Kevin Clifton was drafted in to replace the injured Neil Jones.

He thinks that Gorka Marquez, who missed out on a celeb partner this year, should have got the call up.

(Image: Getty Images)

James said: "I've got nothing against Kevin. But Kevin was on the show. He had his celebrity partner.

"Gorka hadn't. He was on the show last year. It wasn't his choice. It would have been a nice nod to Gorka for a week.

"Kevin's been there and done it. For Gorka it would have been a nice thing."

James isn't shy when having his say on Strictly, but believes the judges actually got the decision right this weekend.

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

Catherine Tyldesley was controversially booted out with pro partner Johannes Radebe - sparking outrage from a large section of viewers.

James, who admitted he is often "very controversial", claimed the public have no case to be angry.

He said: "I'll call BS. On paper Catherine has been better on the show. They're only there to judge the dance off. That's a fact.

"When Dev [Griffin] went out that for me was more controversial because he should have gone home. For me they've got it right."

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm .
